paper: FingerTip 20K_ A Benchmark for Proactive and Personalized Mobile LLM Agents

alignment.note: Coverage alignment is high for strengths but extremely low for weaknesses. The AI review successfully identifies key contributions like the real-world dataset and novel tasks, but it completely misses the human reviewers' main concerns (e.g., limited baselines, narrow fine-tuning scope, missing related work) and instead raises a different set of technical issues regarding evaluation metrics and reporting inconsistencies.

The AI review perfectly covers all strengths mentioned by the human reviewers. However, it misses most human-raised weaknesses (e.g., limited baselines, missing related work, narrow fine-tuning scope) and instead introduces several major, distinct criticisms regarding evaluation metric validity, action space inconsistencies, and lack of statistical rigor.

The AI review successfully identifies all key strengths (real-world data, novel tasks, rich context) but misses several high-level weaknesses raised by humans, such as missing related work, the deployment gap (reliance on explicit intents), and criticism of the fine-tuning scale and ethics discussion. Instead, the AI focuses heavily on technical and methodological flaws (metric validity, statistical reporting, action space inconsistencies) that the human reviewers did not mention.

The AI review shows very high alignment on the paper's strengths. However, there is a major divergence in weaknesses; the AI focuses on detailed methodological critiques of the evaluation metrics and experimental design, while the human reviews raised broader concerns about the scope of experiments, data generalizability, and the gap to real-world deployment.
